lexUnit.name: pile.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place (things) one on top of the other

sentence.text: Then we barricaded ourselves in , piled our mattresses against the cell door .
To reinforce the point , he piled coal against the door .
Earlier that morning , she had piled the bedsheets in a corner of the room ; a sweet aroma of grapes still clung to them .
There was a pile of logs and some firelighters and paper in a large basket in the hearth , and Preston started to pile them in the grate while she continued her explorations in the garden .
When they 'd gone Maggie gathered up the rest of the dishes and piled them in the sink .
She had piled her long hair into a sleek chignon , and tiny wisps escaped across her brow and to the nape of her neck .
Michael followed him out and helped pile the waste branches into heaps for burning and then they stacked the scattered lengths of the firewood .
Pile the fruits into it , scattering the butter and sugar between layers .
Jessamy piled her bags into the boot of Julius 's car , then slid into the front seat , which was of soft leather and almost too comfortable .
People had piled the fallen stones into the shape of an altar , and had put a white lace-edged cloth on top .
My mum was piling tinned ravioli into the trolley .
` It all sounds highly organised , " said Melissa , piling whipped cream on her fromage blanc and pretending not to hear Iris 's scathing comments about cholesterol .
While she piled all the groceries on the counter and the girl began to check them out Stuart sat by the door and looked round .
And now she was going to pile it on thick and heavy .
She flittered in the kitchen , piling crockery onto the table .
She forced the sad and crushed skull below the snow and piled the ice above it .
Luke said savagely , turning to glare at Callum , who continued to pile food on to a plate .
And , more touching , ` We 'd find that , while we 'd been asleep , she 'd piled all the ornaments on top of our bed .
The wood is piled into the kiln , which is then lit at the bottom .
The bodies of 6 ewes and a ram were piled onto a tractor trailer near where they drowned in the Stretford Brook .
Whisk the egg whites to stiff snowy peaks , gradually beating in 4 oz sugar , then pile the meringue mixture over the pudding .
She piled a week 's dirty clothes into the washing-machine , and sat down with a book .
